p: Influenza infections continue to pose a serious problem. Recent outbreaks of avian influenza (H5N1) have had a huge economic effect in the poultry breeding sector [ 2, 3] but besides the economic effect, human health is at stake because avian influenza can also infect mammals including humans [ 4, 5]. The increasing incidence of resistance to antiviral drugs is a major concern to public health. Because strains tend to become more aggressive, adequate therapeutic strategies are needed [ 6].
